page.title: 14YEAVELEY SCHOOL IN 1985
page.content: In 1985 Yeaveley school has 19 pupils, 5 infants and 14 juniors. We use the old school building for dinner, P.E., etc. We work in a two-room Terrapin; one is for lessons and another for art and craft. Some of the lessons we have include Maths and English. We do a lot of topics. We have done Indians, Eskimoes, Wheels, Tudors, Weather and sight. Each week we go swimming at the Ashbourne baths. We also do other sports like running, and join in the Dove Valley Swimming Gala and Sports Day. We also have a Sports Day of our own. When we are 11 we go to Queen Elizabeth's Grammar School in Ashbourne. At the end of this year the other pupils of this school will go to Longford School in the next village as this school is closing as there would be only 13 pupils left here.
